column5: no meals, but great bear hunting and fishing.
Check out Bear Paw Lodge on Caribou Lake, near Armstrong Ont
Thanks for all the resorts people have sent in. this is such a hard job picking a good resort. But it is all part of the fun of planning a trip of a lifetime.
Atikwa Lake Lodge out of Nestor Falls. Amazing bear hunts... its a fly in, and guaranteed an opportunity at a bear.

I'm looking for a bear and fishing outfitter in Canada. Would like to have it all guided with the meals included. Would be willing to do our own meals if not offered by the outfitter. We will have six hunters. Has any one been on that trip of a life time and would like to share their secret spot or any other info you might have. Thanks for your responses.

Check out www.birchdalelodge.com on Eagle Lake 807-227-5262 owners name is Marcel. The Bullpit Steakhouse is part of the lodge so you order off of a menu instead of everyone eating the same thing. While I'm not a bear hunter, I have seen some nice bear taken while I have been up there.
X2 what NARDA said ! I got a 515 lber. back 2010, went back and 2013 and the Son shot 1 with a bow but never found it Headed back up this yr. for redemption .
try Nungesser lake lodge Red Lake 647-478-2904

Take a look at Black Bear Lodge on Red Lake. I'm not sure that they offer guided hunts, but Jim ( owner) is actively involved in every group's hunt. Fishing options consist of walleye, perch, northern, burbot and lake trout ( catch and release only). I believe they book bear hunts through the end of August. All meals are included. PjShorthorn
Not a hunter but you might want to check out Maynard Lake Lodge. The accommodations, food and fishing are excellent. Josh, the owner is an avid hunter and runs a first class operation.
Give a look at Caribou Falls Lodge in Ontario. They will give you a better rate for a group of hunters. http://cariboufalls.com/home.html

Leaving for 5 Lakes Lodge on Gullrock in 34 1/2 days for a Bow Bear Hunt/Fishing trip with a buddy. I have fished there for years and have always been happy. This will be my first Bear Hunt there. Meals are not provided. I have seen some nice trail cam pics and hope to call it my secret spot in the near future. The owner/guide has lived in the area all his life and has recently obtained some new BMA's that haven't been hunted on in several years. We will be the first to hunt a couple of them this year.
